page.title: 02Land cover
page.content: The area is one of high wooded areas disected by two minor streams, the Umborne Brook and the Offwell Brook which both run into the River Coly, then via River Axe to the sea at Seaton. The general appearance is one of small dairy farming in the valleys with woods and high meadows in the elevated areas. The main Waterloo Exeter railway line disects the east section, with a short section of the A35 (Honiton-Folkston Trunk road) clipping the north east corner. 2 minor roads of local importance run N-S connecting Honiton & Colyton. The other roads are unclassified. Parts of the low lying valleys are liableto flooding with the unclassified minor roads quickly closed.If the snow falls heavily this area is quickly cut off. Rape is a currently popular crop.
